Header: Drug smugglers use cocaine packs as floaties in dramatic sea rescue
Content: Three alleged drug smugglers were rescued from the Pacific Ocean’s high seas off Colombia’s coast by members of Colombia’s army after they were found using their cocaine packs as floaties. According to officials, the smugglers’ boat sank forcing those onboard to use their cargo to keep them afloat. Authorities report 1.2 tonnes of cocaine was seized by coast guard officers alongside the trio, who will now face drugs-related charges.
